summary: This bill, the Streamlined FEMA Cost Exemption Act, aims to streamline and modify certain provisions within the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act. Key changes include shortening the recoupment period for certain assistance, granting the President waiver authority for assistance, and establishing an acceptable error ratio for FEMA allocations. The bill primarily focuses on simplifying and improving the process of providing federal aid related to major disasters and emergencies, aiming for more efficient and effective aid distribution.
